Entries.default: "Welcome to the Bardatto estate. Kindly watch your step."
"A pleasure working with you."
"Hmph. Some nerve showing your face around here."
"Halt or you're dead!"
"Deceitful cur! I'll answer your treachery with blood."
"I take it that Ezzali clued you into the plan?" The worry lines running down this guard's face speak to years of duty and command. He scrutinizes you with a cautious, if friendly, expression.
"Why not just kill the Valeras now?"
"We cannot arm Atello with any indictment against the Bardattos."
"Gellarde! I had my doubts, but Ezzali's trust in you was well-placed."
"We will see to the mess shortly. Your thanks and bounty await you upstairs." Captain Vilami offers a curt but respectful bow.
"Freedom of the estate doesn't mean you get to ignore me."
"You will wait in the shadows of the vault. We will bring up the rear with reinforcements."
"What's in this vault, anyway?"
"I'm ready. Let's get started."
[Leave] "I'll handle this later."
"Don't wander too far. And try not to touch anything."

"I don't intend on losing any good men or women tonight." 

He looks you over and nods.
"Even if we're getting the drop on these Valera scum, I'm not about to stake a client's fortune on our success."
"What do we do once the thieves arrive?"
"We do what comes naturally." He touches the pommel of his sword.
"My guards will keep a low profile and watch out for the Valeras. Be sure you do the same."
"A modest sum and a few cobwebs. We've relocated most of the wealth and valuables."
"What can I do for you?"
"It's a good thing her aim was about as shaky as her plan." Vilami winces as he applies pressure to his wounds.
"Go on and head up to Ezzali. She'll want to hear what happened."
"Are you going to be all right?"
[Leave] "I'll do that."
"Some help you were."
"Get out of here and report to Ezzali. We're done." Vilami grimaces and watches you leave.
"I've seen worse. I'll have someone fetch a qualified chirurgeon who knows how to pull out cheap bullets." Vilami winces again and dismisses you.
"My patience has limits, thief! Your orders from Atello, now!" Captain Vilami shouts hoarsely.
"Captain, we're not alone!" One of Vilami's guards redirects all focus in your direction.
"You? Madiccho, were you spying for the Valeras from the beginning?"
"Where did Atello get the coin for outside help?" Captain Vilami regards you with a grimace.
"Captain. A pity that we meet under these conditions."
"Any interest in parting ways and forgetting we saw each other here?"
"Stand aside. I'm just interested in the contents of that vault."
"Stand aside, captain. I'd rather not kill you."
"I'm sure we can work this out reasonably."
"Such an offer. What do you say I just play it all evasive until we inevitably come to blows?" The thief's hand strays near her pistol.
"I'll make sure you die like the rest of these Valera rats!" Vilami moves to attack.

"Belda, I'll see your head mounted in the foyer for this!"

Vilami signals for his guards to attack.
"I'll be dragging this one upstairs to confess her crimes. If that means going through you, so be it!"
"I am sure that the thieves, as well, prefer direct confrontation over the alternative."
"Ezzali wants this handled cleanly, and without loose ends."
"Will any traps be installed to counter the burglars?"
"Standard procedure is to trap the area around the vault. We've moved them all inside."
"You'll thank us when you don't lose any limbs."
"Good work here. At least we get to limp away from this in one piece." Vilami waves.
"Not all of us are as careless with our allegiances as you."
"Report to Ezzali."

"Shame, that."

Serafen scratches his cheek with a single finger.
Captain Vilami shuts his eyes and exhales a long breath.
"Bold words. Can you back them up? I don't want to get into a fight with you at my side only to find out it was all bravado."

"Not bravado. Experience." 

Vilami glances sidelong at Pallegina, smiling faintly.
"Relocated to where?"
"Beyond your reach, lady."
"Bad offers never lead anywhere good."
"Per complanca, we don't have time for this nonsense!"
"I'm open to questions until we begin execution of the plan."
"If he told the Huana that we struck first, we will all end our days in the Gullet."
"Reason died the moment you got involved." Vilami signals his men to attack.
"Serafen, please don't-"

"Only thing preferable to a plan so simple be going up the rear meself."

He bounces his furry eyebrows.

Maia squeezes the bridge of her nose.

Captain Vilami mirrors the gesture.
"Care to elaborate?" The captain strokes his chin and frowns at Serafen.

The Guard-Captain takes his time moving to the barred door, his armor creaking with every step. 

He appraises you with a lazy sweep of the eyes, while his fingers curl casually about the hilt of his blade.
"You have an appointment to see the vault, sir?"
Entries.female: "Welcome to the Bardatto vault. You have an appointment, madam?"

Entries.default:
"Di verus? Just exploring the vault that holds the Bardatto fortune? 

"Per complanca, go upstairs before I have to sully my lady's tiles."
"I was just exploring."
[Lie] "I'm working for Ezzali."
"A vault? What's in here?"
"Sorry, I think I took a wrong turn."
"Then you are welcome- AFTER she sends a messenger to vouch for you."

"The Bardattos are a banking family, mestre. We hold a great many accounts belonging to our fellows within the Vailian Trading Company. 

"We also safeguard those valuables they entrust to our keeping."
Entries.female:
"The Bardattos are a banking family, mestra. We hold a great many accounts belonging to our fellows within the Vailian Trading Company. 

"We also safeguard those valuables they entrust to our keeping."

Entries.default: "Ac, so you did. You will find better welcome upstairs."

"Slinking about a private estate at night seems a good way to get killed. 

"I will warn you only once."
"This area is off limits. Return the way you came."
"A matter you may discuss with the lady. Upstairs."
"Alarm! Thief in the vault!"
The captain makes a herding motion with his arms as he shepherds you toward the stairs.
[Attack] "No, but you have an appointment with Berath."
"To arms! We are under attack!"
